intro: Semecarpus ochraceus, commonly known as the yellow tamarind tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing edible seeds. Its botanical features include a taproot system and the ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
